name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
description: Holiest Sikh shrine with gold-plated sanctum, Sarovar (holy pool), 24/7 open for worship, community kitchen (langar) serving 100,000+ daily, spiritual and architectural marvel.

name: Jallianwala Bagh
description: Memorial site of 1919 Jallianwala Bagh massacre, preserved bullet marks on walls, martyrs' well, eternal flame, museum depicting British colonial atrocities, independence movement history.

name: Wagah Border
description: India-Pakistan border with daily Beating Retreat ceremony, synchronized military drill, flag-lowering ceremony, patriotic atmosphere, spectator galleries, unique Indo-Pak tradition since 1959.

name: Anandpur Sahib
description: City of Bliss where Khalsa was founded by Guru Gobind Singh in 1699, multiple gurudwaras, Kesgarh Sahib, Hola Mohalla festival, Virasat-e-Khalsa museum, Sikh pilgrimage center.

name: Virasat-e-Khalsa Museum
description: State-of-the-art museum showcasing 500 years of Sikh history and culture, interactive exhibits, multimedia displays, architectural marvel by Moshe Safdie, 300th anniversary of Khalsa commemoration.

name: Bathinda Fort
description: Qila Mubarak, one of India's oldest surviving forts (1000-1700 years old), where Razia Sultana was imprisoned, Sikh heritage, Guru Gobind Singh visited, ancient brick structure.

name: Sheesh Mahal, Patiala
description: Palace of Mirrors within Qila Mubarak complex, museum with miniature paintings, arms collection, coins, medals, Patiala royal artifacts, Mughal and Rajput art, 19th-century architecture.

name: Qila Mubarak, Patiala
description: Patiala royal fort complex founded 1763, multiple palaces including Sheesh Mahal, Darbar Hall, museum, royal architecture, Sikh heritage, UNESCO tentative list for World Heritage Site.

name: Kila Raipur Rural Olympics
description: Rural Olympics since 1933, traditional Punjabi sports including bullock cart races, tractor races, kabaddi, horse riding stunts, showcasing rural Punjab culture and strength.

name: Sukhna Lake
description: Artificial reservoir at Shivalik foothills, boating, water sports, walking track, bird watching, migratory birds in winter, Asian Rowing Championships venue, Le Corbusier's vision.

name: Rock Garden
description: Nek Chand's sculpture garden created from industrial and urban waste, 40-acre open-air exhibition with thousands of sculptures, waterfalls, unique art installation, recycled art masterpiece.

name: Pul Kanjari
description: Historical site built by Maharaja Ranjit Singh for Moran, his Muslim wife, serene baoli (stepwell), gurudwara, temples, mosques, picnic spot, architectural heritage.

name: Ram Tirth
description: Legendary birthplace of Luv and Kush (sons of Lord Rama), associated with Valmiki Ashram, holy tank, temple complex, annual fair, Ramayana connection, pilgrimage site.

name: Talwandi Sabo
description: Damdama Sahib, one of five Takhts of Sikhism, where Guru Gobind Singh compiled final version of Guru Granth Sahib in 1705, significant Sikh heritage, gurudwara complex.

name: Kanjli Wetland
description: Man-made wetland and bird sanctuary, 150+ bird species, migratory waterfowl, boating, eco-tourism, Ramsar site nomination, birdwatching paradise, winter migratory birds.

name: Phillaur Fort
description: 19th-century fort built by Maharaja Ranjit Singh on Sutlej River banks, British-era police training center, historical significance, architectural heritage, red brick structure.

name: Harike Wetland & Bird Sanctuary
description: Largest wetland in northern India, Ramsar site, confluence of Sutlej and Beas rivers, 300+ bird species, migratory Siberian birds, boat safari, eco-tourism, biodiversity hotspot.

name: Hoshiarpur Cultural Hubs
description: Birthplace of Punjabi cinema, wood carving craftsmanship, inlay work tradition, Shivalik hills foothills, Kamahi Devi temple, Takhni-Rehampur Wildlife Sanctuary, cultural heritage.

name: Ranjit Sagar Dam
description: Thein Dam on Ravi River, vast reservoir surrounded by hills, water sports, boating, fishing, picnic spot, scenic beauty, hydroelectric project, tourist destination.

name: Punjab Heritage & Folk Festival
description: Annual cultural festival celebrating Punjabi heritage, traditional folk music and dance (Bhangra, Giddha), handicrafts, cuisine, rural sports, showcasing Punjab's vibrant culture.
